Instrument.name: HISCALE Low-Energy Foil Spectrometer for Ulysses
Instrument.description: The Low-Energy Foil Spectrometers (LEFS) are designed to measure low-energy electron and ion fluxes with high sensitivity through pulse-height analysis and active anticoincidence. There are two main types, LEFS 60 and LEFS 150, differentiated by their inclination relative to the spacecraft spin axis, providing nearly complete 4Ï€ coverage during spins. Each LEFS consists of two identical 200 micrometer thick silicon surface barrier detectors and a thin (5 micrometer) silicon detector. A thin aluminized parylene foil in the LEFS 60 and 120 prevents ions (~350 keV) from reaching some detectors while allowing lower energy electrons (~30 keV) to pass. The system includes various channels for detecting different energy ranges of electrons and ions, with provisional passbands that will be refined through in-flight calibration. The detectors and their configurations are detailed in accompanying tables, alongside references to related calibration and data processing work.
